definition[0]: to practise or make people practise something such as a play or concert in order to prepare for a public performance
example[0]: I think we need to rehearse the first scene again.
example[1]: The band was rehearsing for their world tour.
definition[1]: to practise something that you plan to say to someone
example[2]: She had carefully rehearsed her resignation speech.
definition[2]: to repeat an opinion that has often been expressed before
